paragraphs.text:
%md

Preparing data for all Spark/Cassandra demos
============================================

For those demos to work, you'll need:

1. A working **Cassandra** server, version **2.0.x**, **2.1.x** or **Datastax Enterprise 4.7.x**
2. A running **Spark** cluster deployed in **stand-alone mode** (a stand-alone local deployment is fine)
3. You may need to tune the `$ZEPPELINE_HOME/conf/zeppelin-env.sh` file to change the **MASTER** parameter. By default it is set to `spark://127.0.0.1:7077`
4. You may need to tune the `$ZEPPELINE_HOME/conf/zeppelin-site.xml` file to change the default Zeppelin **port**. I set it to **9080** to avoid any conflict with the **Spark Master GUI** running on port **8081**
    ```xml
    <property>
        <name>zeppelin.server.port</name>
        <value>9080</value>
        <description>Server port. port+1 is used for web socket.</description>
    </property>
    ```
5. You **should** add the parameter `spark.cassandra.connection.host` to the **Spark Interpreter** config. I set the value to `127.0.0.1` for Cassandra host name but you can adapt it to fit your own Cassandra deployment.
    <center>![Zeppelin Interpreter](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/incubator-zeppelin/Spark_Cassandra_Demo/assets/Zeppelin_Interpreter.png "Zeppelin Interpreter Parameters")</center>
6. The notebooks **07-DSE Search in action** and **08-SearchAnalytics Mode** require **Datastax Enterprise 4.7.x**. Do not run them if you're using an open-source **Cassandra**
7. The notebook **09-Demos Cleanup** will clean up all data downloaded and created for those demos
8. You should have `wget` and `curl` commands **installed** and **working**
9. You should have `Maven 3.1.x` and `Bower` **installed** and **working**

result.msg:
Preparing data for all Spark/Cassandra demos

For those demos to work, you'll need:

  1. A working Cassandra server, version 2.0.x, 2.1.x or Datastax Enterprise 4.7.x
  2. A running Spark cluster deployed in stand-alone mode (a stand-alone local deployment is fine)
  3. You may need to tune the $ZEPPELINE_HOME/conf/zeppelin-env.sh file to change the MASTER parameter. By default it is set to spark://127.0.0.1:7077
  4. You may need to tune the $ZEPPELINE_HOME/conf/zeppelin-site.xml file to change the default Zeppelin port. I set it to 9080 to avoid any conflict with the Spark Master GUI running on port 8081
    <property>
    <name>zeppelin.server.port</name>
    <value>9080</value>
    <description>Server port. port+1 is used for web socket.</description>
</property>
  5. You should add the parameter spark.cassandra.connection.host to the Spark Interpreter config. I set the value to 127.0.0.1 for Cassandra host name but you can adapt it to fit your own Cassandra deployment.
  6. The notebooks 07-DSE Search in action and 08-SearchAnalytics Mode require Datastax Enterprise 4.7.x. Do not run them if you're using an open-source Cassandra
  7. The notebook 09-Demos Cleanup will clean up all data downloaded and created for those demos
  8. You should have wget and curl commands installed and working
  9. You should have Maven 3.1.x and Bower installed and working

paragraphs.title: Downloading cassandra data for demo
paragraphs.text:
%sh

rm -rf /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo 2>/dev/null

mkdir /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo
chmod -R 777 /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo

wget -O /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/music.cql 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/Cassandra-Spark-Demo/master/src/main/data/music.cql'
wget -O /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/performers.csv 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/Cassandra-Spark-Demo/master/src/main/data/performers.csv'
wget -O /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/albums.csv 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/Cassandra-Spark-Demo/master/src/main/data/albums.csv'
wget -O /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/countries.csv 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/Cassandra-Spark-Demo/master/src/main/data/countries.csv'

wget -O /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/us_unemployment.cql 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/Cassandra-Spark-Demo/master/src/main/data/us_unemployment.cql'
wget -O /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/us_unemployment.csv 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/Cassandra-Spark-Demo/master/src/main/data/us_unemployment.csv'

wget -O /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/solrconfig.xml 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/Cassandra-Spark-Demo/master/src/main/solr_config/solrconfig.xml'
wget -O /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/performers_schema.xml 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/Cassandra-Spark-Demo/master/src/main/solr_config/performers_schema.xml'
wget -O /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/albums_schema.xml 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doanduyhai/Cassandra-Spark-Demo/master/src/main/solr_config/albums_schema.xml'

paragraphs.title: Create Cassandra schema
paragraphs.text:
%sh
`which cqlsh` -e "CREATE KEYSPACE IF NOT EXISTS spark_demo WITH replication = {'class': 'SimpleStrategy','replication_factor' : 1}"
`which cqlsh` -e "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS spark_demo.performers(name TEXT,country TEXT,gender TEXT,type TEXT,born TEXT,died TEXT,styles LIST<TEXT>,PRIMARY KEY (name))"

`which cqlsh` -e "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS spark_demo.albums(performer TEXT,title TEXT,year INT,country TEXT,quality TEXT,status TEXT,PRIMARY KEY(title))"

`which cqlsh` -e "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS spark_demo.albums_by_country(title text,country text,performer text,quality text,status text,year int,PRIMARY KEY((country,year),title))"

`which cqlsh` -e "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS spark_demo.countries(name TEXT PRIMARY KEY)"

`which cqlsh` -e "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS spark_demo.performers_distribution_by_style(type text,style text,count int,PRIMARY KEY (type, style))"

`which cqlsh` -e "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS spark_demo.top10_styles(type text,count int,style text,PRIMARY KEY (type, count)) WITH CLUSTERING ORDER BY (count DESC)"

`which cqlsh` -f /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo/us_unemployment.cql

paragraphs.title: Insert data into Cassandra
paragraphs.text:
%sh

cd /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo

`which cqlsh` -e "COPY spark_demo.performers(name, country, gender, type, born, died,styles) FROM 'performers.csv'"
`which cqlsh` -e "COPY spark_demo.albums(performer,title, year, country, quality, status) FROM 'albums.csv'"
`which cqlsh` -e "COPY spark_demo.countries(name) FROM 'countries.csv'"

paragraphs.text:
%md

Below tasks are for Datastax Enterprise Only (demos 07 & 08)
============================================================

#### Please ensure that you have started your **DSE** instance in **SearchAnalytics Mode** (e.g. `dse cassandra -s -k`)

result.msg:
Below tasks are for Datastax Enterprise Only (demos 07 & 08)

Please ensure that you have started your DSE instance in SearchAnalytics Mode (e.g. dse cassandra -s -k)

paragraphs.title: Creating Solr cores for albums and performers tables
paragraphs.text:
%sh
cd /tmp/spark_cassandra_demo

curl http://localhost:8983/solr/resource/spark_demo.performers/solrconfig.xml --data-binary @solrconfig.xml -H 'Content-type:text/xml; charset=utf-8'
curl http://localhost:8983/solr/resource/spark_demo.albums/solrconfig.xml --data-binary @solrconfig.xml -H 'Content-type:text/xml; charset=utf-8'

curl http://localhost:8983/solr/resource/spark_demo.performers/schema.xml --data-binary @performers_schema.xml -H 'Content-type:text/xml; charset=utf-8'
curl http://localhost:8983/solr/resource/spark_demo.albums/schema.xml --data-binary @albums_schema.xml -H 'Content-type:text/xml; charset=utf-8'

curl "http://localhost:8983/solr/admin/cores?action=CREATE&name=spark_demo.performers"
curl "http://localhost:8983/solr/admin/cores?action=CREATE&name=spark_demo.albums"
